Describe Bivariate

Source: R/describe.R
describe_bivariate.Rd

Describe Bivariate

describe_bivariate(data, target, p.min = 0.05, alpha = 0.05,
  verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A data frame to describe.
target

The target to describe.
p.min

Minimal proportion in a group (a ctree_control argument).
alpha

Minimal critetion (a ctree_control argument).
verbose

verbose.

Examples


data("german_credit")

dbiv <- describe_bivariate(german_credit, target = good_bad)
#> 
  |                        
  |                  |   0%
  |                        
  |=                 |   5% status_of_existing_checking_account                      
  |                        
  |==                |  10% duration_in_month                                        
  |                        
  |===               |  15% credit_history                                           
  |                        
  |====              |  20% purpose                                                  
  |                        
  |====              |  25% credit_amount                                            
  |                        
  |=====             |  30% savings_account_or_bonds                                 
  |                        
  |======            |  35% present_employment_since                                 
  |                        
  |=======           |  40% installment_rate_in_percentage_of_disposable_income      
  |                        
  |========          |  45% personal_status_and_sex                                  
  |                        
  |=========         |  50% other_debtors_or_guarantors                              
  |                        
  |==========        |  55% present_residence_since                                  
  |                        
  |===========       |  60% property                                                 
  |                        
  |============      |  65% age_in_years                                             
  |                        
  |=============     |  70% other_installment_plans                                  
  |                        
  |==============    |  75% housing                                                  
  |                        
  |==============    |  80% number_of_existing_credits_at_this_bank                  
  |                        
  |===============   |  85% job                                                      
  |                        
  |================  |  90% number_of_people_being_liable_to_provide_maintenance_for 
  |                        
  |================= |  95% telephone                                                
  |                        
  |==================| 100% foreign_worker

# NOT RUN {
data(chileancredit, package = "smbinning")
data <- subset(chileancredit, select = -c(period))
describe_bivariate(data, target = fgood)

# }
